title: Chipotle Stock Got a Lift From Earnings. Why It Didn’t Last.
text:
Chipotle Mexican Grill stock is falling, reversing gains that came immediately after the burrito chain disclosed its third-quarter earnings.

The back story. While many fast-food stocks have done well in 2019, Chipotle has left its rivals in the dust, racking up year-to-date gains of more than 90%. Investors have cheered strong earnings and the addition of carne asada to its menu, as well as rapidly growing digital and delivery orders. Analysts have rallied around Chipotle and predicted more returns to come.

...
description: The burrito chain disclosed stronger-than-expected third-quarter results on Tuesday, but now analysts are weighing in with their views.
